name: Substrate Condition (grain size/embeddedness/fines/consolidation)
functionStatement: Supports aquatic habitats through streambed material and bedform dynamics. Enhances habitat complexity and streambank stability.
descriptionMarkdown: "Fine sediment deposition/embeddedness as an indicator of sediment imbalance and habitat condition for benthic organisms and fish spawning. Presence and clarity of expected bedform sequence (riffle-run-pool or step-pool) indicate organized transport and habitat variety. Combines substrate size distribution, embeddedness, and consolidation or armoring to assess pore space and habitat quality."
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Channel

Method: Field screening; Field
howToMeasureMarkdown: "Conduct a field screening to visually estimate fine sediment deposition or embeddedness in representative riffles/runs, or use an approved protocol referenced by the applicable SQT. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric. Perform a pebble count to estimate percent gravel and cobble versus fines. Estimate percent of coarse grains buried by fines during a field visit. Use a pick test or visual checks to identify surface crusting, cementing, or heavy armoring. Visually classify dominant substrate along the reach (bedrock, boulder, cobble, gravel, sand, silt or clay) and note the relative amount of fines and embedding."

inputs.label: Substrate Condition (grain size/embeddedness/fines/consolidation)
inputs.helpMarkdown: "Field observations (pebble counts/visual estimates) and/or existing habitat survey data. "

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Open interstitial coarse bed with minimal fines. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Mild embedding or partial fine coverage. / Strong embedding or siltation limiting infiltration. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Predominantly fine or consolidated bed with little interstitial space. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)
